reviewText: The Adventures of The Wilderness Family is a great movie about a man who decides to move his family from the city because of his daughters allergies and asthma being worsened by all the air pollution and because he is tired of all the traffic etc, they move to a remote cabin in the wilderness and have a lot of adventures with many wild animals! I recommend this move which is Great movie for the whole family

reviewText: It's just hard these days to find movies like this.  Typical "get away from society and back to nature" storyline.  But it's a reflection of the desire to have a simple lifestyle, to be engaged with nature and to find love within the family unit.  Through in a couple goofy characters (Boomer), some Bear pets, and a tussle with a mountain lion and lookout!  Good natured, family entertainment for sure! And yes, it's hookey, but what's wrong with that?  Great movie for the family, but might be a bit too corny for kids in their teens.
summary: Simple and Enjoyable Movie for The Young Family
Title: N/A

reviewText: There came a time during the 1970s and 1980s when stories dominated in the theaters:Billy JackWilderness Family RobinsonEmerald ForestThe Gods Must Be CrazyGrizzly AdamsAcross the Great DividePlus several others which I can't recall.Yes, there also were the mega hits, Battle Star Galactica, Indiana Jones, E.T., etc. these were blockbusters heavy in special effects plus story, but these all were big money films.The common denominator was adventure. Further, several were independent films. My favorites were:- Billy Jack, created by Tom Laughlin, who passed away last December.- The trilogy of the Wilderness Family Robinson films.Bear in mind, I was a young guy serving in the US Navy, living in LA but stationed in San Diego. I commuted weekends and, an occasional weekday. I was fed up with taking orders and getting stuck in traffic jams. I wanted my boys to grow up among nature, just like the Robinsons.This trilogy is a good story for your children, it is good inspiration for adults. We all can strive for our passion and enjoy this miracle we call life.My dream was to live life my way, among nature. These films fed my dream.I give five stars to this trilogy because it is more than a story. It is a fantastic inspiration. besides the movies listed above, some reading material that feeds the same hunger:- Countryside & Small Stock Journal- Backwoods Home- Home Power- Small Farm Journal- Farmer's Weekly (by Caxton Publishers in South Africa)- the original (1970 through 1980) Mother Earth News
summary: Wilderness Family Robinson: Inspiration for Nature Lovers & Homesteaders

Title: N/A

reviewText: Everything about this movie is sugarcoated and totally unbelievable as to how life really would be for this family moving to the wilderness, cut off from civilization, from easy LA city living.  Picture quality is also horrible.Examples of unrealistic situations: Family "hides" from bear on top of 10ft. cabin which the bear could easily climb if it wanted to.  Mom pets wild bird that lands on her stove; tells daughter a raccoon is "gentle"; later same raccoon crawls into bed with son; dad and son survive rock avalanche; next dad and son play with baby bears and even bring them into the cabin with them; boy and girl play with baby cougar cubs; dad survives cougar attack.  Curiously we still see bags of sugar/flour on the table.The dialogue and inter-family relations are as if the  family still lived in the city.  The girl and woman physical appearances are always perfect.  In addition, the man is consistently saying everything will be ok and I'll take care of it. The girl is chased by wolves then a bear then gets a high fever, for which the dad has to go for help; meanwhile the boy gets thru everything fine. (stereotype of woman as weaker sex).The overarching themes are that man is more powerful than nature and can survive any creature, though the reverse is more likely (when left without his weapons); and also that humans can control and/or tame nature; that there is nothing dangerous in the wilderness; that it's a cake-walk.One of the stupid instructions given by the mom is that you should boil bark from an Aspen tree if you have a headache bc thats how you make "Aspen" (play on the word aspirin I assume).  While feeding a full-sized black bear, the daughter says "what do we do when we run out of food? and the dad replies "maybe get back up on the roof lmao.  Then the bear eats You thats what happens.  they even play teetor-tottor with the bear OMG I couldn't wait to see what laughable scene came next...Wilderness living is basically the opposite of everything in this movie, strenuous all-day work--growing vegetables, +hunting, fishing, building fire, keeping away from predators--much of it is about simple survival, like a wild animal--NOT having fun wrestling with cougar cubs and fishing with bears.  I hate to say it but I enjoyed it a bit when a bear came and broke in the house and the woman didn't even know how to use the gun to shoot it---their beloved friendly bear Samson ended up coming and saved them.Though I am a realist I also try to be an  optimist--I admit I may have enjoyed this film in my childhood (being far away from any of the real dangers in nature--and good thing bc if I went by this movie, I'd be dead in a day).  I love the concept of getting away from city life and would love to be able to live in nature.  However, I do not try to deceive myself about the reality of the natural world.This is a feel-good film not to be taken seriously at all and I think its a shame we are so far from real living in our modern world that we show our children hokey films like this one.
summary: Totally sugarcoated and unbelievable tale of a family living in nature.

reviewText: Of course, the premise of escaping the big city life with it's stress, materialism and pollution to live a "simple" life in the wilderness with all it's natural beauty, is welcome anytime.  However, the film soon shows that living in the wilderness is anything but "simple".  I enjoyed this film as much now as I did almost 40 years ago when I first saw it as a small child.  My seven year old liked it also, though the wolf and grizzly scenes were a little too intense for him.  I wouldn't mind seeing a modern version, one complete with updated technology, more educational experiences, and maybe not so many scary intense scenes.
summary: Still love it after all these years!

reviewText: The Wilderness Family is a movie that makes me think of an American Swiss family Robinson type movie.  It's a story about a family learning to survive outside the realms of normal life.  We see them struggle and we see them survive.This is a movie that while it's like the Swiss Family Robinson, its not completly like them.  The movie is about half as good but for children and families struggling in our current world trying to find good family entertainment, it is good enough.The cinematography is sub par, and the acting is pretty good, but the scenery and the animals are really cool.So I say if you you don't have the disney version of the Swiss family Robinson buy that instead, but if you already have it and want some good family entertainment, pick this up, you won't beat the price, and it really was enjoyable
summary: The Wildreness family is one Bear of a movie!

reviewText: People such as ourselves, who appreciate classics of HOLESOME GOODNESS, vs. the garbage being made today will really appreciate this wonderful classic called The Adventures of the Wilderness Family. This movie was released in the same ERA as Willy Wonka & the Chocolate Factory, The Daring Doberman Gang/The Daring Dobermans, Little House on the Prairie, Highway to Heaven, Tales from the Darkside (the series), & as many other classical favorites of the time. If you grew up as a child watching & loving holsome movies like Lassie Come Home, would know that is the kinda stuff this film is made of. So interested buyers cannot go wrong purchasing this film with confidence! Thanks, Mary
summary: Holesome family goodness at it's best for it's time!

reviewText: I remember watching this movie when I was a kid and how much I enjoyed it, so when I found it on here I had to get it to share with my own kids.  They loved every minute of it, my daughter now wants to go live in the mountains so she can have  a pet raccoon, too.  The best part about this movie and movies like it is that you don't have to worry about "screening" it first.  So many of the new movies, even those made for family viewing, contain scenes that are not entirely appropriate for children.  This one is a wholesome family movie that contains real family values.

reviewText: I saw these three excellent films when I was only 12 years old (I am now 41) and I really loved them all. The scenary, the beautiful animals, the adventures and basically the closeness of the famly living together in the wild really got me and reminded me of my family except we didn't live in the wild. Robert Logan is a brilliant actor as are the other cast members.These films are a must buy in my opinion if you like the outdoors and brilliant films for the family of all ages to enjoy again and again. To have them in my DVD collection now after all this time has made my day.

reviewText: If you love the outdoors or nature then this movie is for you.  If you are more comfortable in the woods than in city traffic then this movie is for you.  If you would like to experience what it would be like to total be off the grid where your very survival depends on you and your family then this movie is for you. A really nice movie about living out in the wild all by yourself with no real neighbors expect the occasional old miner who stops by most of the time for a good cooked meal. Where the only communication you have is a short wave two way radio.  No phone, no televisions, no dishwasher, no washer or dryers.  In return you get nature in all of it's magnificence, and various types of animals that have called where your now living home long before you got there.  Some of the animals are friendly and nice, some not so nice but you have a family dog that will take on anything and it is never usually him that losses the fight.
summary: A movie the whole family can sit and watch

reviewText: The premise of this movie is a couple with two kids who live in LA decide they're fed up with traffic and city life and sell everything they own to move to a small cabin on a rural piece of mining land they inherited. They must be flown in by plane and are surrounded by mountains and a lake/river. The kids befriend wild animals and the family also faces show-downs with wolves, a bear, and various other animals through the three movie series (of which this is the first). This is a good family/kids movie, but my husband and I who are in our 30's and don't have kids, happened across it and liked it enough to buy it. It's fun to watch someone do what we wish we were doing. There are realistic aspects and some unrealistic. We don't really see how they have a continuous supply of food, but at various times we see them fishing, hunting, having chickens, making a garden, and getting shipments via plane. They deal with a family member getting sick and having to split up to get help without a radio. The kids are charming. The dad is pretty easy going. The mom is reasonably stressed by the situation. Overall, it has enough realism to make it enjoyable to adults and enough fun/adventure (ex: befriending a bear) for kids to be enthralled. It's continuously entertaining without being loud and overly action packed.

reviewerName: Staci L. Wilson "Author: Animal Movies Guide ...
reviewText: An eco-friendly husband (Robert Logan) and wife (Susan Damante-Shaw) move their family from the city to a remote cabin in the wilderness where they encounter a variety of forest wildlife, including harmless deer and harmful bears. There are some hair-raising fight scenes between the faithful family dog and a bristling bruin. The Further Adventures of the Wilderness Family followed in 1978.Staci Layne Wilson
